snippet: At least 20 people were gunned down, reviving the trauma and outrage from a deadly attack on a school in Peshawar in 2014.
abstract: At least four Taliban attackers stage attack on Bacha Khan University in Charsadda, Pakistan, killing at least 20 people; officials say attackers were killed before being able to detonate their suicide vests; attempt comes after year in which Taliban in country had been marginalized, and raises concerns that insurgency maintains ability to carry out brutal attacks.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH, IHSANULLAH TIPU MEHSUD and ISMAIL KHAN
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from Cairo, Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan. Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi, Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong, and Salman Masood from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: At least 20 people were gunned down, reviving the trauma and outrage from a deadly attack on a school in Peshawar in 2014.

headline.main: Taliban Attack at Bacha Khan University in Pakistan Renews Fears
headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack Pakistan School, Renewing Fears
